meaningMnemonic: You should <radical>say</radical> "<radical>peace</radical>" before you <kanji>evaluate</kanji> a situation. That way everyone will know where you’re coming from. If you’re honest and say "peace" before you evaluate a situation out loud, everyone will know where you stand.
readingMnemonic: When you say "peace," you end up making a really bad pun and you hear somebody say “<reading>Heyo</reading>!” (ひょう) You look at the people around you and try to <kanji>evaluate</kanji> who said heyo, but you can’t tell.
